title: Strictly Come Dancing week 4 dances revealed as Will Bayley and Janette Manrara take on Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello
text:
Who’s going to make it through for another week? (Picture: BBC)

After the excitement of Movie Week that saw Katya go flying twice, Craig put his foot in it over Anton Du Beke’s teeth, and Anneka Rice making a quick exit, it seems there’s no slowing down for Strictly Come Dancing with this week’s dance routines.

David James and Nadiya Bychkova are hoping to stop their bottom two streak and will take on The Greatest Showman song From Now On by Hugh Jackman in the form of a Quickstep routine.

Meanwhile at the top of the leaderboard, after winning the first 10s of the series, Oti Mabuse and Kelvin Fletcher will be slowing things down with a Rumba to Ain’t No Sunshine by Bill Withers.

Will and Janette in the meantime are leaving their Pokemon outfits behind them and turning their attention to latin for a Foxtrot to Señorita By Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Anton will be keeping his teeth in for this week, and will be returning to his strong suit in ballroom with Eastenders’ Emma Barton performing a Viennese Waltz to Send in the Clowns by Barbra Streisand

So who has what it takes to make it through another week?

With the competition tighter than ever, it seems that Kelvin and Oti are getting the bookies vote as the standout favourites of the series at 6/4, with David James and Mike Bushell coming down at the bottom.

But Michelle has been climbing up the ranks after last week’s Cabaret inspired performance with Giovanni Pernice, now third at 6/1 behind Karim (3/1) and Kelvin.

Voting will take place on Saturday evening, with the dance-off and first elimination being aired on Sunday night’s show.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

Strictly Come Dancing 2019 Week 4 Routines Alex and Neil: Tango to Go Your Own Way by Fleetwood Mac Catherine and Johannes: Charleston to Single Ladies by Beyoncé Emma and Anton: Viennese Waltz to Send in the Clowns by Barbra Streisand Emma and Aljaž: Jive to Kids in America by Kim Wilde Michelle and Giovanni: Salsa to Quimbara by Johnny Pacheco and Celia Cruz Saffron and AJ: Couple’s Choice: Contemporary to Because You Loved Me by Celine Dion Chris and Karen: Jive to Saturday Night’s Alright (For Fighting) by Elton John David and Nadiya: Quickstep to From Now On by Hugh Jackman Dev and Dianne: Cha Cha to Dancing With a Stranger by Sam Smith featuring Normani Karim and Amy: Tango to Paradise by George Ezra Kelvin and Oti: Rumba to Ain’t No Sunshine by Bill Withers Mike and Katya: Quickstep to Come on Eileen by Dexys Midnight Runners Will and Janette: Foxtrot to Señorita By Shawn Mendes and Camila Cabello
